intro: Stenogyne serpens, commonly known as the serpentine stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many diverse species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, serpentine-like stems and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and streamside areas. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
